item.description: What I would do with 1,000,000 dollars is buy toys for my sister, nice dresses and earrings for my mom, and Reeses and new shoes for my dad. Then, I would buy lot of beautiful fabric and art materials. Last, I would go all around the world in amazing private plane. That’s just some things I would do with 1,000,000 dollars!

item.title: My Superpower
item.description:
If I had a superpower, I would have the superpower to fly really fast. I would have that power because I think it would be amazing to fly up to the giant clouds and get to places quickly.

I would help people with my superpower by flying up high to look for a little girl’s doll that she lost, or saving a young boy from falling off a high edge. I would help with anything else anyone needed. I am Scarlett the amazing superhero!

item.title: Holes
item.description: In the book Holes there is a boy named Stanley. He went to school and was a pretty big kid, and he got laughed at for that. One day, he was walking under a bridge on his way home from school and from out of the top of the bridge, shoes fell down on him. They were a famous baseball players shoes. The cops came by and took him to court. They gave him the choice to go to jail or Camp Green Lake. He chose Camp Green Lake.

item.title: 100 Dresses
item.description:
The Hundred Dresses, by Eleanor Estes. The theme is forgiveness.

In the book The Hundred Dresses, there is a girl named Wanda. She went to school like any other normal kid, but she had been missing school. In Wanda’s class there was a bunch of kids, but Peggy was the prettiest. Peggy’s best friend was Maddie. They did everything together. Maddie thought she knew why Wanda was missing school. It all started on a beautiful day, Wanda got to school and Peggy asked Wanda how many dresses she had. Wanda only had one dress but she didn’t want to tell everyone that so she said she had one hundred, all lined up in her closet. Everyone started asking her that every day and Maddie could tell that was making Wanda feel uncomfortable. That was why Wanda wouldn’t come to school. Maddie felt bad and so did Peggy.

item.title: One Mile Race
item.description:
I trained for a one-mile race once. Every Wednesday, I would practice.

  • On the first Wednesday of practice, I ran two minutes and walked one minute five times.
  • On the second Wednesday, I ran three minutes and walked one minute four times.
  • On the third Wednesday, I ran five minutes and walked one minute two times.
  • The fourth Wednesday I ran a whole mile without stopping to walk.

I ran with some of my neighbors from Crocker Court, so we made shirts that said Crocker Cruisers. It was a blast!

item.title: Where The Red Fern Grows
item.description:
Where the Red Fern Grows, by Wilson Rawls. The theme is working hard to get what you want and loss.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Billy. When Billy was really young he loved to catch things lizards with he hands, when he got a little older, he got little traps to catch little critters. Soon, he got tired of the traps and so desperately wanted two hunting dogs. He asked his parents several times, but they said it was too much money. Billy started losing weight because he wanted two hunting dogs so bad. One night after Billy saw people leave their camp, he saw they had left a newspaper behind.
